contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Officeholder | name =Boniface Alexandre | image =Boniface Alexandre.jpg | imagesize =200px | smallimage = | caption = | order =[[List of Heads of State of Haiti|54th]] [[President of Haiti]] | office = | term_start =February 29, 2004 | term_end =May 14, 2006 | primeminister =[[Yvon Neptune]]<br />[[Gérard Latortue]] | predecessor =[[Jean-Bertrand Aristide]] | successor =[[René Préval]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1936|7|31}} | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | party = | spouse = | relations = | children = | residence = | alma_mater = | occupation = | profession = | religion = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} '''Boniface Alexandre''' (born 31 July 1936) is a [[Haïti]]an politician . He served as [[acting (law)|acting]] president of Haïti from 2004 to 2006. The [[2004 Haitian coup d'état]] removed President [[Jean-Bertrand Aristide]] from the [[Americas]] on February 29, 2004. Following this, Alexandre, as the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court and therefore next in the presidential [[line of succession]], assumed the office of president. During Alexandre's acting presidency, [[Amnesty International]] reported "excessive use of force by police officers", [[extrajudicial execution]]s, a lack of investigations into these, escalation of "unlawful killings and kidnappings by illegal armed groups", failure of officials to prevent and punish violence against women, dysfunctionality of the justice system, and forty or more people [[habeas corpus|imprisoned without charge or trial]].<ref name="amnesty_haitiduring2005">{{cite web| last =| first =| authorlink =| coauthors =| title =2006 Annual Report for Haiti| work =| publisher =[[Amnesty International]]| year =2006| url =http://www.amnestyusa.org/annualreport.php?id=ar&yr=2006&c=HTI|format =| doi =| accessdate =2009-08-06 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5ipoupJCq |archivedate=2009-08-06 |deadurl=no}}</ref> Alexandre left office on May 14, 2006, when [[René Préval]], winner of the [[Haïtian elections, 2006|February 2006 presidential election]], was sworn in as president. He is a nephew of the country's first prime minister, [[Martial Célestin]]. ==See also== *[[2004 Haitian coup d'état]] *[[Politics of Haïti]] ==References== <references /> {{s-start}} {{succession box|title=[[Image:Coat of arms of Haiti.svg |60 px]]<br />[[List of Presidents of Haïti|President of Haïti]]|before=[[Jean-Bertrand Aristide]]|after=[[René Préval]]| years=2004–2006}} {{s-end}} {{HaitiPostDuvalierHeads}} {{Persondata | NAME = Alexandre, Boniface | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Haitian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1936-07-31 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alexandre, Boniface}} [[Category:1936 births]] [[Category:Presidents of Haiti]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Haiti-politician-stub}}
